newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Qantas no interest in airports sale.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Qantas no interest in airports sale.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Thursday it has no interest in taking up its right to a five percent stake in any of the nation's airports that are part of the government's A$2.00 billion privatisation programme.
"We are having too much fun doing what we are doing to get involved in that," chairman Gary Pemberton told reporters.

Managing director James Strong said: "Five percent does not give that much leverage and does not give much of say in running a business." Qantas, 25 percent owned by British Airways Plc, earlier reported a 36.7 percent rise in net profit before abnormals to A$246.2 million. -- Sydney 61-2 373 1800
